brief_title: Women's Use of Alternative Medicine: A Multiethnic Study
brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to examine socio-cultural factors of women’s use of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM). The effects of socioeconomic status, social networks and acculturation on CAM use will be assessed among white, African-, Mexican-, and Chinese-American women.
criteria: Inclusion criteria: Experienced one or more of the following health conditions within the last year: - pregnancy related symptoms - menopausal related symptoms - headaches - back pain - osteoporosis - cancer - high blood pressure - high cholesterol - heart disease - joint pain/arthritis - insomnia - uterine fibroids - urinary tract infection - vaginal tract infection - medically diagnosed depression - menstrual symptoms
